Runge-Kutta Integrator & The Equations of Motion¶

The Equations of Motion¶

Two forces act on atoms ejected into the exosphere: gravity from each object in the system and radiation pressure. The components of the gravitational force are given by:

System Message: WARNING/2 (F_i & = & \sum_p GM (x_i - x_{pi})/r_p^3 \\ r_p & = & \sqrt\left(\sum_j (x_j - x_{pj})^2\right))

where in the first equation are the components of the particle location and are the components of object in the system and the sum is over all objcts included. The second equation gives the distances between each particle and object.
